I&#8217;m not sure of the stories behind all of them, but I did eavesdrop on a few tour groups. This was a dancer&#8230; Angkorian roayal celebrations always involved big dance shows. </div> </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-row" style="width: 479px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="479" data-original-height="159" > <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1095" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1095" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304115.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230411.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304115.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304115.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304115.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230411.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> I found a footprint! Maybe some kid thought it would be funny 800 years ago, to walk in the wet mud&#8230; </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1096" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1096" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304116.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230411.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304116.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304116.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304116.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230411.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> Relief covering the south wall of Angkor wat. A tour guide was describing how this relief tells the story of the judgement and the lives of people who are sent to heaven, earth, and hell. </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1097" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1097" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304117.jpg" data-orig-size="768,1024" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230411.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304117.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304117.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302304117.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230411.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> Here&#8217;s the great judge, carried by servants on earth. Below, are people in hell, getting beaten by the guy on the right. </div> </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-row" style="width: 479px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="479" data-original-height="159" > <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1098" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1098" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230521.jpg" data-orig-size="768,1024" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230521.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230521.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230521.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> Check out my hideous but wat-appropriate dress! Got this gem at a market in Phnom Penh. At the wats, you have to have your shoulders covered and your legs down to your knees. Wearing a dress was cooler than the bike clothes I have, even if I had to hike up the skirt to bike around the wats. </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1099" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1099" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305211.jpg" data-orig-size="768,1024" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305211.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305211.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305211.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> My favorite part of bike commuting&#8230; zooming up through the gate past all the traffic! </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1100" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1100" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305212.jpg" data-orig-size="768,1024" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305212.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305212.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305212.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> Moving on from Angkor wat, this is from Angkor Thom, one of the Bayon style temples, built by another king a hundred years or so after Angkor Wat. Jayavaraman VII built a bunch of temples quickly, so people say these are more sloppy and less detailed than earlier temples like Angkor wat. The big huge heads are also characteristic of Bayon-style temples. </div> </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-row" style="width: 479px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="479" data-original-height="159" > <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1101" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1101" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305213.jpg" data-orig-size="768,1024" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305213.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305213.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305213.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> Relief from a Bayon temple </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1102" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1102" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305214.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305214.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305214.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305214.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> Bike appreciating the terrace of the elephants </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1103" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1103" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305215.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305215.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305215.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305215.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> This is a small temple called Phimeanakas, also part of the Angkor Thom complex. This style of temple is called &#8220;mountain temple&#8221; because of the tiers and pyramid shape. Most of the Angkor temples are considered mountain temples, I read. </div> </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-row" style="width: 479px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="479" data-original-height="159" > <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1104" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1104" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305216.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305216.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305216.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302305216.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230521.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> I found a foot. </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1105" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1105" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230706.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230706.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230706.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230706.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230706.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230706.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> This is the reward for biking all the way out to the farthest eastern wat in the main Angkor park area&#8230; it&#8217;s called Ta Som and a tree is growing over the eastern gate! It&#8217;s slowly destroying the stone, but cool looking nonetheless. </div> </div> </div> <div class="gallery-group" style="width: 159px; height: 159px;" data-original-width="159" data-original-height="159" > <div class="tiled-gallery-item"> <a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1106" border="0"> <img data-attachment-id="1106" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307061.jpg" data-orig-size="768,1024" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230706.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307061.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307061.jpg?w=479" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307061.jpg?w=155&#038;h=155&#038;crop=1" width="155" height="155" data-original-width="155" data-original-height="155" title="wpid-Photo-20140330230706.jpg" alt="" style="width: 155px; height: 155px;" /> </a> <div class="tiled-gallery-caption"> The Villa Siem Reap&#8230; simple but nice guest house with a pool and nice staff. </div> </div> </div> </div> </div>
<p>After Siem Reap, I buckled down and rode 2 more days before crossing into Thailand. My legs were fresh, but the long stretches of unchanging scenery made me cave and plug my headphones in, first time since starting this whole trip. The music was nice, and I apologized in my head to all the kids whose roadside &#8220;Hello!&#8221;s I wouldn&#8217;t hear or shout back to.</p>

			</dt>
				<dd class='wp-caption-text gallery-caption' id='gallery-1116-16-1108'>
				Skinny cow
				</dd></dl><dl class='gallery-item'>
			<dt class='gallery-icon landscape'>
				<a href='https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1109'><img width="150" height="113" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307064.jpg?w=150&#038;h=113" class="attachment-thumbnail" alt="This type of cart was one of the most creative of the homemade vehicles I saw... they&#039;re like tractors with long steering columns. Behind the driver is a big flatbed trailer, probably loaded with things 10 feet tall. It was a fun challenge to try to get pics of these guys while we were both moving down the road.  They didn&#039;t go very fast, a few kph faster than me." aria-describedby="gallery-1116-16-1109" data-attachment-id="1109" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307064.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230706.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307064.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307064.jpg?w=479" /></a>
			</dt>
				<dd class='wp-caption-text gallery-caption' id='gallery-1116-16-1109'>
				This type of cart was one of the most creative of the homemade vehicles I saw&#8230; they&#8217;re like tractors with long steering columns. Behind the driver is a big flatbed trailer, probably loaded with things 10 feet tall. It was a fun challenge to try to get pics of these guys while we were both moving down the road.  They didn&#8217;t go very fast, a few kph faster than me.
				</dd></dl><br style="clear: both" /><dl class='gallery-item'>
			<dt class='gallery-icon landscape'>
				<a href='https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1110'><img width="150" height="113" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307065.jpg?w=150&#038;h=113" class="attachment-thumbnail" alt="Anatomy of a cambodian roadside refreshment stop.  On the right, the ubiquitous big orange cooler.  These are filled with drinks and usually ice. In the center, some box of snacks for sale, and on the left under the umbrella, gas for motorbikes aliquotted into coke bottles. One coke bottle of gas is a liter and costs 50 cents to 1 dollar." aria-describedby="gallery-1116-16-1110" data-attachment-id="1110" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307065.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230706.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307065.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307065.jpg?w=479" /></a>
			</dt>
				<dd class='wp-caption-text gallery-caption' id='gallery-1116-16-1110'>
				Anatomy of a cambodian roadside refreshment stop.  On the right, the ubiquitous big orange cooler.  These are filled with drinks and usually ice. In the center, some box of snacks for sale, and on the left under the umbrella, gas for motorbikes aliquotted into coke bottles. One coke bottle of gas is a liter and costs 50 cents to 1 dollar. 
				</dd></dl><dl class='gallery-item'>
			<dt class='gallery-icon landscape'>
				<a href='https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1111'><img width="150" height="113" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307066.jpg?w=150&#038;h=113" class="attachment-thumbnail" alt="To get a sense of what this ride was like, call to your head all the songs you know about highways, dusty road trips, and lonely deserts.  This here&#039;s my chrome &#039;n&#039; steel. :)" aria-describedby="gallery-1116-16-1111" data-attachment-id="1111" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307066.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230706.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307066.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307066.jpg?w=479" /></a>
			</dt>
				<dd class='wp-caption-text gallery-caption' id='gallery-1116-16-1111'>
				To get a sense of what this ride was like, call to your head all the songs you know about highways, dusty road trips, and lonely deserts.  This here&#8217;s my chrome &#8216;n&#8217; steel. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-smile' title=':)'>:)</span>
				</dd></dl><dl class='gallery-item'>
			<dt class='gallery-icon landscape'>
				<a href='https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1112'><img width="150" height="113" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307067.jpg?w=150&#038;h=113" class="attachment-thumbnail" alt="I&#039;m not sure, but I wondered if all these ducks were for eating.  There were tons of them here, and I saw the same kinds of ducks hanging by their feet from the backs of motorcycles." aria-describedby="gallery-1116-16-1112" data-attachment-id="1112" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307067.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230706.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307067.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302307067.jpg?w=479" /></a>
			</dt>
				<dd class='wp-caption-text gallery-caption' id='gallery-1116-16-1112'>
				I&#8217;m not sure, but I wondered if all these ducks were for eating.  There were tons of them here, and I saw the same kinds of ducks hanging by their feet from the backs of motorcycles. 
				</dd></dl><br style="clear: both" /><dl class='gallery-item'>
			<dt class='gallery-icon landscape'>
				<a href='https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1113'><img width="150" height="113" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230910.jpg?w=150&#038;h=113" class="attachment-thumbnail" alt="I saw this man sitting out here... there was no one else around, and no houses... where did he come from?? I hope the puddle cooled him off a bit. :/" aria-describedby="gallery-1116-16-1113" data-attachment-id="1113" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230910.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230910.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230910.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230910.jpg?w=479" /></a>
			</dt>
				<dd class='wp-caption-text gallery-caption' id='gallery-1116-16-1113'>
				I saw this man sitting out here&#8230; there was no one else around, and no houses&#8230; where did he come from?? I hope the puddle cooled him off a bit. <span class='wp-smiley wp-emoji wp-emoji-uneasy' title=':/'>:/</span>
				</dd></dl><dl class='gallery-item'>
			<dt class='gallery-icon portrait'>
				<a href='https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1114'><img width="113" height="150" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230926.jpg?w=113&#038;h=150" class="attachment-thumbnail" alt="I totally got burned at this roadside snack stand.  I passed a few of these and couldn&#039;t guess what these things were, so I sopped and bought one to try. I assumed some kind of rice-based candy.  WRONG.  These are weird sausage things, and hidden in the middle is a HOT PEPPER.  Big mistake." aria-describedby="gallery-1116-16-1114" data-attachment-id="1114" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230926.jpg" data-orig-size="768,1024" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230926.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230926.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-20140330230926.jpg?w=479" /></a>
			</dt>
				<dd class='wp-caption-text gallery-caption' id='gallery-1116-16-1114'>
				I totally got burned at this roadside snack stand.  I passed a few of these and couldn&#8217;t guess what these things were, so I sopped and bought one to try. I assumed some kind of rice-based candy.  WRONG.  These are weird sausage things, and hidden in the middle is a HOT PEPPER.  Big mistake. 
				</dd></dl><dl class='gallery-item'>
			<dt class='gallery-icon landscape'>
				<a href='https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/?attachment_id=1115'><img width="150" height="113" src="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302309261.jpg?w=150&#038;h=113" class="attachment-thumbnail" alt="As I got close to the border, there were more road signs. This was apparently the only sign worth writing in English." aria-describedby="gallery-1116-16-1115" data-attachment-id="1115" data-orig-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302309261.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,768" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;}" data-image-title="wpid-Photo-20140330230926.jpg" data-image-description="" data-medium-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302309261.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://karlynsandiego.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/wpid-photo-201403302309261.jpg?w=479" /></a>
			</dt>
				<dd class='wp-caption-text gallery-caption' id='gallery-1116-16-1115'>
				As I got close to the border, there were more road signs. This was apparently the only sign worth writing in English.
				</dd></dl><br style="clear: both" />
		</div>

<p>The border crossing was no problem, and after waiting in a long line of tourists in a big building with AC, I was back in a place with busy streets, cars, buildings, and more human activity in general. It was something of a relief, but a little sad at the same time.  The first challenge was to realize that I would be biking on the left and not the right in Thailand&#8230;. been doing ok with that so far. More on the Thai transition in a few weeks!</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
					</div><!-- .entry -->
					</div><!-- /.middle -->
	<div class="fix"></div>
</div><!-- /.post -->
			
				<div id="post-1032" class="post-1032 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-uncategorized tag-vietnam">

	<div class="post-meta col-left">
			<a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/2014/03/14/tour-de-mekong-delta/" title="Permalink to Tour de (Mekong)&nbsp;Delta" rel="bookmark" class="date-link">
		<span class="post-date">
			March 14, 2014			<span class="bg">&nbsp;</span>
		</span>
	</a>
	<ul>
		
		
					<li class="comments"><a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/2014/03/14/tour-de-mekong-delta/#respond">Leave a comment</a></li>
		
			</ul>
	</div><!-- /.meta -->

	<div class="middle col-left clearfix">
		<h1 class="title">
					<a href="https://karlynsandiego.wordpress.com/2014/03/14/tour-de-mekong-delta/" rel="bookmark">Tour de (Mekong)&nbsp;Delta</a>
				</h1>

		
		<div class="entry clearfix">
			<p>After the gluttony and luxury in the Philippines, I arrived in Saigon with a mission.  No more fun and games, folks, time for some serious miles!  If I&#8217;m going to spend quality time in 5 countries in the next 4 months, it means I need to complete my route through Vietnam, Cambodia and Thailand in aboout 5 weeks.  Definitely a different mindset than my first 3 months, dawdling around S. America, biking a few days then staying put for a week&#8230;. but I&#8217;m ready for a little routine and a little more exercise (read: I plan to eat everything that looks remotely delicious).</p>
<p>After a 2-hour flight to Ho Chi Minh City, I met up with Hanh, my good friend Phu&#8217;s aunt.  Hanh is a busy woman who runs several small businesses in Saigon, but took the time to pick me up with my giant bike box at the airport.  I speak zero Vietnamese and she speaks only slightly more English than that, so I got to put the Vietnamese flashcards I made to use right away. This is the first country where I don&#8217;t speak the language at all, so some hilarious adjustments have been required!  I learned I can get by almost exclusively with &#8220;Hello!&#8221;, &#8220;Thank you&#8221;, &#8220;Sorry/excuse me,&#8221; &#8220;Bathroom&#8221;, and &#8220;How much?&#8221;.  Useful secondary phrases include &#8220;What is this?&#8221;, &#8220;Yes I&#8217;m traveling alone&#8221;, &#8220;I&#8217;m 29&#8243;, and &#8220;No, I&#8217;m not marrried and I have no children.&#8221;  (I&#8217;ve learned that all around the world, people get right to the point when asking questions of foreign travelers.)</p>
<p>Hanh kindly put me up in her condo for the first 3 nights, so I could explore the city, reassemble my bike, and get ready to head out.  She was so kind and patient, despite a few cultural SNAFUs&#8230;.!  For example, at one point I thought that shopping for and cooking breakfast for us both would be a nice &#8220;thank you&#8221; for hosting me.  Instead, I thoroughly terrorized the poor woman.</p>
<p>We couldn&#8217;t communicate except via google translate (see pic of completely useless-but-funny translations below&#8230;.), so I just went and bought some veggies, eggs and tofu and tried my best to explain my plan (fail).  Later, I find out (via Skype translator session with Phu), that Hanh was terrified because she thought I wanted HER to cook for ME, using the food I had bought.  Further, broccoli and bell pepper are not standard vietnamese vegetables so Hanh neither likes them nor knows how she would cook them.  And even WORSE, she doesn&#8217;t like spicy food and was scared to even touch the bell pepper (she thought it was a hot pepper), let alone cook or eat it&#8230; all while being frustrated and nervous about communicating this to me or possibly offending me.</p>
<p>Oh god! The poor thing&#8230;. Let the &#8220;experiential cultural education&#8221; continue&#8230;. I have much to learn!</p>
